instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
Device arrived with complaints Audio is out. Reported new headphone jack and speakers.
System report  AUDIO output says "Devices" and box is blank.
Sound settings show no output devices. Volume slider and mute box greyed out. Mute is checked
Slider on display and touch bar volume buttons function correctly.
Safe mode generates no difference.
<CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6300</CHIP> replaced to rule out still no change.
Could this be software related?



Device is on Big Sur. After weekend when trying to login normal device encountered a problem stating critical update needed and fails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
Try first disconnecting webcam.
ALS failure can cause critical update error.

Just in case. check <CHIP>U6360</CHIP> output voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
disconnected Display and used external monitor. Fails update. IS there another way to disconnect webcam?

btw
<CHIP>U6360</CHIP> 
pin 1: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0_LDO_AUD</SIGNAL> "input"   1.8v
pin 2: <SIGNAL>GND_AUDIO_CODEC</SIGNAL>                   0v
pin 3: <SIGNAL>L83_LDO_EN</SIGNAL>  "output"             3.2v
pin 4: <SIGNAL>3V3_S0_AUD</SIGNAL> "output"              3.2v
pin 5: <SIGNAL>GND_AUDIO_CODEC</SIGNAL>                   0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
1V8 output is good.

Be sure <CHIP>U6300</CHIP> gets all voltages; check L6300-2.

Audio codec not recognized, should mean there is a problem with <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>.
Check its resistors and traces to PCH.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6300</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0_LDO_AUD</SIGNAL>, <CAPACITOR>C6301</CAPACITOR>,L6300,L6301 - 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, L6302, 3.294V

<CHIP>U6200</CHIP> Has many resistors. Is there any in particular? I2C,<SIGNAL>ASP_CLK</SIGNAL> etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message: Look at the left side "To PCH" marked lines...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1310</RESISTOR>  <SIGNAL>HDA_BIT_CLK</SIGNAL> , .907v
<RESISTOR>R1311</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>HDA_SYNC</SIGNAL>, .20v
<RESISTOR>R1312</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>HDA_RSTL</SIGNAL> , 1.795v
<RESISTOR>R1313</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>HDA_SDOUT</SIGNAL> , 0v

Checked twice. Yesterday and today values remain same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message: These resistors have correct ohm values?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
You meant 33 ohms I hope.

Did you also check <RESISTOR>R6203</RESISTOR>?
You can have bad <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>, or solders/traces.
Even bad PCH is possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R6203</RESISTOR> climbs to "0.012v" and then back to 0v. 33 ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
Do you still get critical update error message?

You should try known good BIOS.
Just in case, to discard BIOS upgrade failure.
